thread.title: Board approves alcohol sales for football, denies basketball
thread.title_full: Board approves alcohol sales for football, denies basketball

title: Board approves alcohol sales for football, denies basketball
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Board approves alcohol sales for football, denies basketball The Idaho State Board of Education says footballs fans may continue to imbibe at campus games, but basketball boosters must remain dry. Post to Facebook Board approves alcohol sales for football, denies basketball The Idaho State Board of Education says footballs fans may continue to imbibe at campus games, but basketball boosters must remain dry.  //on.ktvb.com/1LPrbqb   Board approves alcohol sales for football, denies basketball Associated Press 1:33 p.m. MDT October 22, 2015 Tailgating at the Boise State - UW home opener (Photo: Gary Salzman / KTVB) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
LEWISTON, Idaho - The Idaho State Board of Education says footballs fans may continue to imbibe at campus games, but basketball boosters must remain dry. The Lewiston Tribune reports that on Wednesday the board approved extending alcohol sales at Boise State University and University of Idaho football games for the rest of this year's playing season. However, BSU's request to permit alcohol sales at pregame basketball events failed 5-3. Board member Richard Westerberg says he thinks the board is sending mixed messages. He added that the board should re-evaluate approving any alcohol sales on college campuses once the football season ends. Alcohol sales at football games were first permitted by the board in June. Before, alcohol service was only approved for corporate sponsors and their guests. Read or Share this story: http://on.ktvb.com/1LPrbqb TOP VIDEOS
